The **put on** command is, by default, mapped to [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [P](/wiki/P "P")

It is used to put on [amulets](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") and eyewear. It is *not* used for wearing armor (see [Wear](/wiki/Wear "Wear")).

If you choose to put on a ring, you may be asked:

```
"Which ring-finger, Right or Left? [rl]"
```

Press [r](/wiki/R "R") or [l](/wiki/L "L") to choose, as indicated.

You are unable to put anything else on when wearing an amulet, two rings, and one piece of eyewear (e.g. a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold")). Additionally, you can't put rings on if you are wearing cursed [gloves](/wiki/Glove "Glove") or wielding a cursed two-handed [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"). If you are wielding a cursed one-handed weapon, you can still put on or remove the left-hand ring; all player characters are right-handed.

You do not have to [T](/wiki/T "T")ake off your gloves to put a ring on. Strangely, you also do not need to take off your gloves if you [W](/wiki/W "W")ore them after putting on a ring, either...

## See also

- [Remove](/wiki/Remove "Remove"), the inverse command

The put on command is, by default, mapped to shift + P

It is used to put on amulets, rings and eyewear. It is not used for wearing armor (see Wear).

If you choose to put on a ring, you may be asked: 

"Which ring-finger, Right or Left? [rl]"

Press r or l to choose, as indicated.

You are unable to put anything else on when wearing an amulet, two rings, and one piece of eyewear (e.g. a blindfold). Additionally, you can't put rings on if you are wearing cursed gloves or wielding a cursed two-handed weapon. If you are wielding a cursed one-handed weapon, you can still put on or remove the left-hand ring; all player characters are right-handed.

You do not have to Take off your gloves to put a ring on. Strangely, you also do not need to take off your gloves if you Wore them after putting on a ring, either...

See also

  • Remove, the inverse command

rawPage:
{{Keyboard Commands}}
The '''put on''' command is, by default, mapped to {{kbd|shift|P}}

It is used to put on [[amulet]]s, [[ring]]s and eyewear. It is ''not'' used for wearing armor (see [[Wear]]).

If you choose to put on a ring, you may be asked:

 "Which ring-finger, Right or Left? [rl]"

Press {{kbd|r}} or {{kbd|l}} to choose, as indicated.

You are unable to put anything else on when wearing an amulet, two rings, and one piece of eyewear (e.g. a [[blindfold]]). Additionally, you can't put rings on if you are wearing cursed [[glove]]s or wielding a cursed two-handed [[weapon]]. If you are wielding a cursed one-handed weapon, you can still put on or remove the left-hand ring; all player characters are right-handed.

You do not have to {{kbd|T}}ake off your gloves to put a ring on. Strangely, you also do not need to take off your gloves if you {{kbd|W}}ore them after putting on a ring, either...

==See also==

* [[Remove]], the inverse command
